Credit to jfeinstein10 on GitHub for SlidingMenu library, attenzione on GitHub for ColorPickerPreference library, nhaarman on Github for ListViewAnimations library, Roman Nurik for his Wizard Pager, chrisbanes on Github for the ActionBar-PullToRefresh libary, Hai Bison on Google Code for the Lock Pattern library, the entire Paranoid Android team for the inspiration behind SlideOver and all of the amazing work that they do, koush for Cyanogenmod\'s Voice+ allowing for Google Voice support, and to all of the translators.

1) Select a preset theme (you can edit this theme by going to Menu -> Edit Theme)
2) Select Menu -> Add Theme and create a new theme by editing those values
- The delete option will delete the current preview (as long as it isn\'t a default theme)
-To get more themes, go to Menu -> Get More Themes
-To set a custom font (applies to all themes) go to Menu -> Custom Font
Please Note: if you select any theme other than one of the first three (Light, Dark, or Pitch Black), these themes will override any other theme settings you have set
Pro users will be able to apply and use any theme you download, but to edit and add themes, you must download the Theme Engine
Select custom font to be displayed throughout app

Sliding Messaging now supports fully customizable themes!

Features:
 - 16 different themeable items
 - Select from any color you want or choose a holo preset
 - Edit lots of previously not themeable elements
 - Share and get new themes online
 - Select a custom font off of your external storage

For more information on the newly refined theme editor, go to Settings -> Custom Theme Settings -> Menu -> Help

Do you like Sliding Messaging? We would love it if you could give us a rating! 5 star ratings warm our hearts :)
 http://goo.gl/zH4eBo 


Reminders:


- If you are having problems with messages not being saved, or you have disabled all other messaging apps on your device except Sliding Messaging, be sure to check the "Override Stock Messaging" option in Advanced Settings.

 - Please check the new section under setting 'Developer Tips' for speed and MMS issues before leaving a bad review or sending us an angry email. It should be able to solve some of your problems.
Will cause the icon displayed on the status bar to flash on and off. Only applies to white stock icon

Sliding Messaging has found that Go SMS is installed. Please note that Go SMS blocks notifications from other messaging apps by default, meaning that you will not receive any notifications from this app at all. You can disable this by going into Go SMS Settings -> Advanced Settings -> Receive Settings and uncheck the \"Disable other message notification\" setting.
Recommended to also disable contact pictures or UI glitches may occur, unless you are running Android 4.2+
Will convert messages to multiple recipients automatically to MMS group messages. Works best on Android 4.2+
Will send messages longer then the desired number of SMS messages as a single MMS instead
Number of SMS messages required to instead send as one MMS message
The state of threads and recipients is inconsistent

Either there is an error in your APN settings, you haven't configured them yet, they are for some reason incompatible, or you are connected to WiFi and haven't checked the WiFi workaround option in MMS settings (sending over WiFi will not work for everyone at this point). 

If you think everything is right already, a reboot never hurt anything ;) If not, check out MMS Settings and see if you can find anything there to help you out.

Due to limitations implemented by Google in Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich),
Google now restricts Sliding Messaging\'s access to the system defined APNs for \"security reasons.\" Because of this, you will need to set the values manually if you
wish to be able to send MMS messages through Sliding Messaging. You can find APN settings for your carrier by going into your System Settings -> Wireless and Networks ->
More… -> Mobile Networks -> Access Point Names and selecting the APN from there that you wish to use, copying the \"MMSC\", \"MMS Proxy\", and \"MMS Port\" values

into Sliding Messaging\'s MMS Settings which you can access through the main settings menu or by selecting the button below. You can also find them through a quick Google search of your carrier name and apn information.\n\n
Until you have correctly set these values, you will not be able to send MMS messages.
Hides the sender name in the dashclock widget
Each number needs to be followed by a comma and space. Example \"0, 400, 100, 400\". The pattern alternates by turning vibrator off and then on for each length specified in milliseconds
Sliding Messaging also has a Pro version available with tons more features! These features include:\n

-Ability to send and view MMS and group messages
-Share dialog to share content such as web links, etc
-6 additional theme choices

-Ability to choose background images for conversation menu and message list
-Custom text color options
-Custom animations
-And tons more!
Pro users also get updates more often and access to all of the latest features.
If you get errors when attempting to send MMS, it is most likely because the APNs that you entered are incorrect or not yet compatible or you are on WiFi which could mess with the connection.
Please email me at jklinker1@gmail.com with your confirmed working APNs and carrier name so I can add them to the app
Some carriers require MMS requests with a username and password, if this is the case for your carrier, set these values
APN username. May need to be set to null
APN password. May need to be set to null
May or may not work and may need some manual editing
Select your carrier from a list a preset APNs to make life a little easier

PLEASE READ: Enabling this will greatly increase the speed of Sliding Messaging, it will also backup all your SMS messages to an external service for safekeeping and delete them from the SMS database. You will not be able to see these messages in Sliding Messaging or any other messaging app.
WARNING: May backup and delete unread messages if scheduled before they are seen.
Keep the last day in the manifest so that you have only those messages after the backup and delete

RECOMMENDED: this will delete all messages after backup is complete to increase speed and fluidity of Sliding Messaging.\nWARNING: it will also delete MMS which are not backed up through this utility.

Override some custom app settings for the most optimized/quickest behavior.\nNOTE: Disables some settings, including contact pictures

With the latest update, we have made a few great strides toward a completely lag free app. But obviously this is a difficult task because of the style and what we are trying to do with the app. It is very memory intensive and uses a lot of resources to load so many messages at once. Many more than any other messaging app has to do. That is why it can be a little more sluggish than most if you have a ton of messages.


As for my speed tip, you have 2 options really. Both are compromises, but that is what you are gonna have to deal with in an app like this:


1.) DELETE MESSAGES! This is what we have been preaching since the beginning. IT WILL HELP YOU :) this is my first suggestion.


I understand that some people may not want to do this though, because they like to keep them for their records. There are backup solutions out there for this purpose. Use them. Deleting messages makes a huge difference if you have a ton of them. For reference, the app works flawlessly, zero lag, on my nexus 4 with around 2000 messages that I have now. I can't test more than that right now obviously, but if you are someone that keeps 10000 on your phone or some ungodly amount like this, obviously this is going to have a severely negative effect with our app.


Like i said, this is my first suggestion to everyone.


2.) Check the "override for performance" option under advanced settings and set your theme to cards 2.0.


This is more of a workaround, but it is, from my experience, a set of default settings that are the most optimized and work the best on any phone. It does take away some of the customization. But your themes and stuff, for the most part, will work. I just took out some of the extra, unnecessary things. This option is a compromise. If you aren't willing to clear out your inbox, try it out. It will work better, I know this for a fact, but it will also take away some of your settings, know that.


3.) Turn off the action bar contact info options!


I know they feel like they should be quick and easy, but they are not, at all. Google must take a heck of a lot of resources to get this stuff to change, because it is quite a dramatic slowdown when you use them. These options can be found under Theme Settings then Title Bar settings. They are the bottom two in that category. Turn them off and feel the power.


I honestly don't want to hear about lag or stuttering that much any more. We have given you the tools to fix it. If you choose not to use them, then so be it. But they are there and that is how this is gonna work :)

This tip is definitely more of a workaround, but I am tired of people telling us that they can't get MMS to download. Sending is a whole 'nother issue, but downloading will work on every phone, every time, if you know how to set it up.


I have emailed this out so many times that I think it is just time to put it in here for everyone to see.


So here is how you should set up downloading MMS messages:


1.) check the receive through stock option.


This option makes it so that it doesn't matter what other settings you have, your message will use the stock apps services to download. It doesn't matter if you have override stock checked or not. This lets the stock app handle all downloads so you don't have to worry about APN's or a WiFi fix that so many people hate us for.


2.) In the stock messaging app, check the auto download option.


This is just what it sounds, it will automatically download your messages for you when the carrier receives them. It isn't slower than having to push the download button, and there really are no downsides to this.


3.) Un-check the auto-download button in Sliding Messaging


This will make sure that you aren't getting double notifications.


So there you go, this is really the best way to handle downloading MMS and it will work flawlessly every time, just like the stock one should. It will still throw the Sliding Messaging notification as well, so no problems there.


EVERYTHING WILL WORK HOW IT SHOULD, EVERY TIME


So now we will have no more problems with downloading MMS! :)

Settings Overview (be aware some of these are only accessible by checking the "Show All Settings" option in advanced settings):


1) Horizontal Positioning determines whether the bubble is on the right or left of the screen
 2) Vertical Positioning sets how far from the top of the screen the bubble is
 3) Sliver Widths changes the amount of bubble you see, lower the sliver width, the less you will see on the edge of the screen
 4) Activation Width is the percent of the screen that the arc covers to activate the popup
 5) Arc Break Point will adjust the length of the dashed line on the bottom half of the arc
 6) Secondary action lets you select what happens when you are in the dashed area, either opening to the conversation list or creating a new message
 7) Enable haptic feedback, that one is self explanatory. vibrate on or off
 8) Auto-close SlideOver will close it when you have replied to a new message, very convenient for exiting quickly and getting back to what you were doing
 9) SlideOver Side changes the padding on the top and bottom of the popup window, making it smaller or much larger. Be careful of setting values to small though, then it wont show at all



Now, as for the main features of SlideOver:


1) There is the new popup which everyone can take advantage of to see an entire conversation when a new message comes in, MMS support for that conversation, etc. Lots better than the old popups
 2) The bubble allows you a "chatheads", yet extremely minimal interface, which you can allows use to pull up the app from anywhere at any time, whether or not you have new messages or just want to compose a new one
 3) When you do have new messages, you can quickly see a preview of each message and depending on how far you slide your finger from the bubble, it will highlight a different conversation which will then allow you to quickly access that conversation. That way, you can allows quickly tell how many new messages you have and decide which you actually want to respond to first, or at all
 4) There are 3 buttons at the top of the window when SlideOver has been activated and the arc is shown on screen to easily allow you to clear all of the notifications, close slideover all together and get the bubble out of the way, or go to settings to move it around or whatever you want to do with it

I get a lot of questions as to "why I can't see my contact pictures" or "some of my contacts don't show up in the app?!"


There is good reason for this, it is because we only pull pictures and contacts from your google account. The reason behind this is 1) it is easier for us, and 2) it is quicker because we only have one place to look for pictures, decreasing loading times.

As for the solution, there are many apps out there that will accomplish this task for you quickly and easily. I recommend:


1.) Haxsync


2.) Contact Picture Sync


3.) Ubersync


All these programs work well and will get you the contact pictures that you want so dearly :)
Use only SlideOver to handle notifications, hiding them from the status bar. WARNING: This will disable LED functionality.

I've had multiple requests to take advantage of the new APIs introduced in Android 4.3 that allow for listening to when notifications are posted and dismissed and taking advantage of that for marking a message as read.


Any users who is on Android 4.3 can now do this by going into their system settings, security, and clicking the "Notification Access" option (or simply by clicking on this tip).


You will then be taken to a list of all apps which have added this ability and simply enable Sliding Messaging with the check box. From now on, whenever you swipe away the notification it will mark your message as read, eliminating the need for the "Read" button on the notification!

Thanks for purchasing Sliding Messaging Pro!\n\n
It may seem like there is a lot going on at first, but lets walk you though some initial setup, then you will be able to configure everything else on your own from the settings menu.
Check option if a white box appears around your SlideOver popup when using a custom background
There are locked messages in this conversation, do you want to delete them?
It\'s our Facebook ChatHeads and Paranoid Android Halo implementation. The idea behind it is that the most used app on your phone, messaging, is always accessible
If you can\'t find what you are looking for in any of the sections above, email us before giving a one star review. It never hurts to ask for help!

Hope you have enjoyed your trial!\n\nThe trial of Sliding Messaging Pro has now expired and if you wish to continue using the app, please upgrade to the full version. You will be able to continue using the free version as of now, but with extremely limited functionality.
None, send all messages as SMS

Do you have data or WiFi enabled and is your Google account set up for Google Voice? If not, you must set that up online first. If so, try going into Google Voice settings and reselecting the account you want to use.

Set Up Google Voice Message Receiving:

Syncs messages instantly when you receive them through Google Voice by listening for a notification. You must have the Google Voice app installed and notifications enabled from that app for this option to work correctly.


NOTE: This is currently experimental as it seems enabling the notification listener (from the link obtained by tapping this setting) can cause the app to misread some incoming SMS and not throw the notification when they arrive if Sliding Messaging has been cleared from the recent apps menu.


We are aware of the problem and are looking into it. If you are missing notifications, disable the notification listener for now and use a different method to receive Google Voice messages.
Sets a refresh interval to intermediately go and check for new messages. Does not require the Google Voice app to be installed
If you have problems, please read the \"Developer Tip\" on receiving Voice messages

1) Android 4.3+ users can use the notification listener service, and users below that you need to use the accessibility service (both of which can be enabled by clicking the "Option 1" button).

 2) The accessibility service cannot cancel Google Voice notifications (this is a limitation of the Android system), but if you turn them off through the Voice app then Sliding Messaging won't receive the messages at all. If you are using OPTION ONE, you must have notifications enabled for Google Voice, meaning Jellybean (4.1 and 4.2) and ICS (4.0) users will get double notifications
Enable Swipe to Mark as Read
Android 4.3 ONLY. Please read the developer tips on how to implement this function
This low of an interval will use more battery and data!
Launch from the extension with SlideOver instead of the main app
Select how you should be notified when your message has been delivered
Adds a button to the bottom of SlideOver that will take you to the full app. NOTE: For best results, set SlideOver height to 100%
Only will work if you have an account selected for Google Voice.
Swipe in the middle to go between messages
All Conversations begin with a default of sending through SMS.
To switch to Google Voice, simply click the icon next to the message entry field!
Messages sent with Google Voice will be marked with the same icon, next to the date and time of the message.
That\'s it!\n\nThe status of the conversation is automatically remembered so you don\'t have to choose Google Voice or SMS every time!
Be aware, some carriers only allow for message up to 1 MB, so setting the above values to high may result in delivery failure

Automatically reset the sliver to the normal position after the following amount of time (configurable with \"Show All Settings\" enabled). Applies after a new message has come in and the SlideOver bubble pings out.
Sets the SlideOver bubble to the new sliver width if there is a new message when the screen is unlocked. Timeout settings will apply

Can't find what your looking for?


Sliding Messaging has a TON of options, and it probably seems overwhelming at first, so we have hidden the more advanced ones for your convenience.


If you feel like taking the customization to the next level, simply go to "Advanced Settings" and click the "Show All Settings" button!

Use this option if the SlideOver Messaging bubble disappears after so long on your screen. It is because the system is killing the service used to create it. This option will get around that by putting a persistent notification on your notification tray.
